content: c h i r o m i t t e n s knitted in sleek stockinette the chiro fingerless mittens offer a versatile and timeless accessory that pairs effortlessly with both minimalist and textured knits 2024 | free pattern | knitsoever | en workflow you ll start by knitting the main body then work back and forth to create the thumb opening after that the pieces are rejoined and the rest of the glove is knit in the round ribbing at the wrist is done without the mohair to avoid any irritation once the thumb stitches are picked up the cap for the finger is shaped using german short row finally the glove is finished with a simple cast-off and the 2x2 ribbing gets a clean finish with a 2x2 tubular bind-off size and fit one size designed to fit a hand circumference of 17 cm / 6 75 in gauge 26 st x 35 row equals 10x10cm / 4 x 4 in in stockinette washed and blocked notions 3 mm / us 2 5 circular needles 4 double-pointed needles 1 stitch marker scrap yarn or stitches holder yarn light fingering + lace held together 120 +100 m fine sock by litlg in colour night 425m/100gr 120 m + premia by lamana in colour anthracite 04 300m/25gr 100 m note this free pattern serves as a framework for independent knitting encouraging you to explore and learn certain techniques on your own while it is designed to be beginner-friendly you should be familiar with the following techniques german short row 2x2 ribbing magic loop method picking up stitches 2x2 tubular bind-off method social media if you enjoyed the pattern share your project on instagram or ravelry and tag me or the pattern - i d love to see it check more photos on instagram via hashtag #chirofingerlessmittens disclaimer unauthorized reproduction distribution or resale of this pattern in whole or in parts is strictly prohibited this includes sharing on any platforms or modifying for resale 2 step 1 with 3 mm needles cast on 36 stitches using the long-tail cast-on or your preferred method step 2 knit all stitches in the next round then use the magic loop method to distrib- ute the stitches evenly 18 stitches on each needle step 3 knit 30 rounds or 9 cm / 3 5 in in stockinette or to your desired length before splitting for the thumb step 4 for the thumb split knit 18 stitches from needle 1 then 18 stitches from needle 2 turn your work and purl back across all 36 stitches continue knitting back and forth like this for a total of 20 row or 5 cm / 2 in step 5 reconnect the pieces to knit in the round again and work 8 more rounds in stockinette step 6 for the ribbing work k2 p2 across the round continue for 36 rounds or 10 cm / 4 in of 2x2 ribbing then finish with a 2x2 tubular bind-off step 7
